argument.tooltip: Main seed value for map generation within Dwarf Fortress.
Seed value for history generation within Dwarf Fortress.
Seed value for name generation within Dwarf Fortress.
Seed value for creature generation within Dwarf Fortress.
Size of the map in the X direction.
Size of the map in the Y direction.
Points available to purchase skills and equipment prior to embarkation.
Year when world generation will stop no matter what.
Year to start checking for world gen end due to too many beast deaths.
Percent of beasts dead needed to stop world gen prematurely.
Reveal All Historical Events.
Cull unimportant historical figures.
Minimum elevation.
Maximum elevation.
Elevation variance in the X direction.
Elevation variance in the Y direction.
Minimum rainfall.
Maximum rainfall.
Rainfall variance in the X direction.
Rainfall variance in the Y direction.
Minimum temperature.
Maximum temperature.
Temperature variance in the X direction.
Temperature variance in the Y direction.
Minimum drainage.
Maximum drainage.
Drainage variance in the X direction.
Drainage variance in the Y direction.
Minimum volcanism.
Maximum volcanism.
Volcanism variance in the X direction.
Volcanism variance in the Y direction.
Minimum savagery.
Maximum savagery.
Savagery variance in the X direction.
Savagery variance in the Y direction.
I'm not sure what this means.
0 - 20 percent.
20 - 40 percent.
40 - 60 percent.
60 - 80 percent.
80 - 100 percent.

20 - 40 percent.
40 - 60 percent.
60 - 80 percent.
80 - 100 percent.
Choose combinations of North/South Poles, or choose None if using the PWDF temperature map
Mineral scarcity. The lower this number is the more minerals there will be.
Maximum megabeast caves.
Maximum semi-megabeast caves.
Number of randomly generated titans.
Population reached to allow your fort to ba attacked by titans/forgotten beasts.
Exported wealth achieved to allow your fort to ba attacked by titans/forgotten beasts.
Created wealth achieved to allow your fort to ba attacked by titans/forgotten beasts.
Number of randomly generated demon types.
Number of randomly generated night troll types.
Number of randomly generated bogeyman types.
Number of randomly generated vampire types.
Number of randomly generated werebeast types.
Number of randomly generated secret types.
Number of randomly generated regional interaction types.
Number of randomly generated disturbance interaction types.
Number of randomly generated evil cloud types.
Number of randomly generated evil rain types.
This flag allows randomly generated divine materials.
Desired number of good squares found in small regions.
Desired number of good squares found in medium regions.
Desired number of good squares found in large regions.
Desired number of evil squares found in small regions.
Desired number of evil squares found in medium regions.
Desired number of evil squares found in large regions.
This is actually the exact number of mountain peaks that will occur.
Minimum number of partial ocean edges. Generally not used with PerfectWorldDF.
Minimum number of complete ocean edges. Generally not used with PerfectWorldDF.

This is actually the exact number of volcanos that will appear, providing there are enough squares with the highest possible volcanism. The maximum is normally 200 but this can be exceeded. Using too many volcanos can cause various world rejections.
Minimum number of individual wetland squares.
Minimum number of initial wetland regions.
Minimum number of final wetland regions.
Minimum number of individual desert squares.
Minimum number of initial desert regions.
Minimum number of final desert regions.
Minimum number of individual forest squares.
Minimum number of initial forest regions.
Minimum number of final forest regions.
Minimum number of individual mountain squares.
Minimum number of initial mountain regions.
Minimum number of final mountain regions.
Minimum number of individual ocean squares.
Minimum number of initial ocean regions.
Minimum number of final ocean regions.
Minimum number of individual glacier squares.
Minimum number of initial glacier regions.
Minimum number of final glacier regions.
Minimum number of individual tundra squares.
Minimum number of initial tundra regions.
Minimum number of final tundra regions.
Minimum number of individual grassland squares.
Minimum number of initial grassland regions.
Minimum number of final grassland regions.
Minimum number of individual hills squares.
Minimum number of initial hills regions.
Minimum number of final hills regions.
Number of erosion cycles. PerfectWorldDF tends to create maps with smooth brownian motion, so you will generally want this field to be less than the default to prevent melting away your mountains.
River starts placed before erosion happens.
River starts remaining after erosion happens. Possible rejection value.
This option will erode extreme cliffs. Without this set, all rivers will cut straight into the earth with no sloping river banks.
This option causes DF to create rain shadows. Normally not used with PerfectWorldDF, which has its own mechanism for this on the rainfall map.
Maximum number of subregions. Possible rejection value.
Number of cavern layers. Setting this to zero will prevent underground cultivation, as the needed seeds will not exist.
Minimum openness, or size, of caverns.
Maximum openness, or size, of caverns.
Minimum amount of dense passages in cavern layer.
Maximum amount of dense passages in cavern layer.
Minimum amount of water in the caverns.
Maximum amount of water in the caverns.
Allow a magma layer.
If you don't know what this is, just say yes. ;) This will force a magma layer also.
The number of Z-Levels of air above the highest surface level.
The number of Z-levels above the first cavern layer.
The number of Z-levels above the second cavern layer.
The number of Z-levels above the third cavern layer.
The number of Z-levels above the magma layer. See the wiki for spoiler information.
The number of Z-levels above the bottom layer. See the wiki for more info.
Generally the height of the bottom layer, but not predictible. See the wiki for more info.
Minimum size of surface caves. If caves are large enough, they may link up to the caverns.
Maximum size of surface caves. If caves are large enough, they may link up to the caverns.
Exact number of mountain caves. Caves are home to terrible creatures and can be a mortal threat to civilization if there are too many.
Exact number of non-mountain caves. Caves are home to terrible creatures and can be a mortal threat to civilization if there are too many.
This option makes all caves visible on the map.
Allow initial embark options to show tunnels, wich in previous versions of DF were like underground roads. This tag is not used in DF 31.x
Total number of civs to place when history gen starts. Setting this too high can cause rejection.
This is a world wide population cap that applies to all beings who are members of a civilization. Setting this too high can cause history gen to take forever.
This is the cap on civilization related sites. It does not affect caves, lairs etc.
This option decides whether to reject the map if no playable civ exists. Usually you will want to reject such worlds as they cannot be played in fortress mode.
Minimum low elevation squares.
Minimum mid elevation squares.
Minimum high elevation squares.
Minimum low rainfall squares.
Minimum mid rainfall squares.
Minimum high rainfall squares.
Minimum low drainage squares.
Minimum mid drainage squares.
Minimum high drainage squares.
Minimum low savagery squares.
Minimum mid savagery squares.
Minimum high savagery squares.
Minimum low volcanism squares.
Minimum mid volcanism squares.
Minimum high volcanism squares.
